Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member DeBlasio.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

Council Member DeBlasio moved  that the Invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.Title:
Communication from the Board of Elections in the City of New York - Submitting the Results of the Election of Letitia James, as the new Council Member of the 35th Councilmanic District, Kings County.

THE CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE DULY ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBER LETITIA JAMES TAKING HER OATH OF OFFICE.

Items.MatterName: Submitting the Results of the Election of Letitia James, as the new Council Member of the 35th Councilmanic District, Kings County.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 030490 ZSM, a special permit shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 030489 ZRM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 465 Broadway, Manhattan (030490ZSM)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to creating a domestic violence fatality review advisory board.
Items.MatterName: Creating a domestic violence fatality review advisory board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to tax exemptions for city-supervised mitchell-lama developments.
Items.MatterName: Tax exemptions for city-supervised mitchell-lama developments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter, in relation to reviewing the fire prevention code.
Items.MatterName: Reviewing the fire prevention code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency lighting and exit signs.
Items.MatterName: Emergency lighting and exit signs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to mandating that Borough Presidents provide training to community board members and staff on their obligations to comply with the New York City Pro-Voter Law.
Items.MatterName: Mandating that Borough Presidents provide training to community board members and staff on their obligations to comply with the NYC Pro-Voter Law.

Items.Title: Resolution expressing solidarity and support for the people of California in the wake of the State's recent wildfires and urging President George W. Bush and the United States government to immediately provide the necessary resources to combat the lingering negative effects of the wildfires, including the possible threat of floods, mudflows and landslides.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Support for the people of California in the wake of the State's recent wildfires.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to awards for the surviving spouse or domestic partner and children of deceased employees of the Department of Transportation and the Department of Environmental Protection.
Items.MatterName: Awards for the surviving spouse or domestic partner and children of deceased employees of the Dep't of Transportation and Dep't of Environmental Protection.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to health insurance coverage for the surviving spouse or domestic partner and children of deceased employees of the Department of Transportation and the Department of Environmental Protection.
Items.MatterName: Health insurance coverage for the surviving spouse or domestic partner and children of deceased employees of the Dep't of Transportation and  Dep't of Environmental Protection.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the General Business Law to require all car dealerships that negotiate contracts in non-English languages to also provide consumers with a corresponding written contract in the same language.
Items.MatterName: Amend the General Business Law to require all car dealerships that negotiate contracts in non-English languages to also provide consumers with a corresponding written contract in the same language.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring owners and purchasers of motorized scooters to procure and maintain a policy of personal injury and property damage liability insurance for any damage, injuries or deaths resulting from the ownership, operation or use of a scooter, and to require owners of motorized scooters to register them with the police department, and to require merchants of motorized scooters to post notice of legality of scooters in retail establishments.
Items.MatterName: Requiring owners and purchasers of motorized scooters to procure and maintain a policy of personal injury and property damage liability insurance for any damage, injuries or deaths resulting from the ownership.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority-New York City Transit to reduce the number of articulated buses used in New York City and replace them with non-articulated buses sufficient to meet the ridership demands, as articulated buses increase passenger capacity but fail to increase the number of seats for disabled passengers.
Items.MatterName: MTA - NYC Transit to reduce the number of articulated buses used in NYC and replace them with non-articulated buses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to establishing an office of Emergency Volunteers under the auspices of the City's Department of Emergency Management.
Items.MatterName: Establishing an office of Emergency Volunteers under the Dep't of Emergency Management.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to amending the New York City Pro-Voter Law by mandating annual training for agencies, verbal assistance for the public and agency transmission of registration forms.
Items.MatterName: Amending the NYC Pro-Voter Law by mandating annual training for agencies, verbal assistance for the public and agency transmission of registration forms.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to posthumously bestow the Presidential Medal of Freedom upon Father Mychal Judge.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: US Congress to posthumously bestow the Presidential Medal of Freedom upon Father Mychal Judge.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on President Bush, Congress and Governor Pataki to provide New York City with its fair share of funding to develop and implement an emergency volunteer corps.
Items.MatterName: President Bush, Congress and Governor Pataki to provide NYC with its fair share of funding to develop and implement an emergency volunteer corps.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of violations  to residential property owners for failure to keep abutting sidewalks free from litter.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of violations to residential property owners for failure to keep abutting sidewalks free from litter.

Items.Title: Resolution honoring the Italian soldiers who lost their lives in the bombing that took place in Iraq on November 12, 2003.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Honoring the Italian soldiers who lost their lives in the bombing that took place in Iraq on November 12, 2003.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to study the long-term effects of living and working near multiple antennas and base stations.
Items.MatterName: Study the long-term effects of living and working near multiple antennas and base stations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in five business improvement districts.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in five business improvement districts.
